content.description: The researchers built an enclosure to prevent migration into and out of the O’Neill rock pocket mouse population for a period of two years.
content.question: Which of the following best predicts the effect of the enclosure on the O’Neill population?

choices.label: The O’Neill population will rapidly evolve into a separate species.
The O’Neill population will become less diverse due to the bottleneck effect.

The frequency of the <math alttext="M C l R D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele will decline due to natural selection.

One of the alleles for the <math alttext="M C l R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene will become fixed due to genetic drift.

content.answer: The frequency of the <math alttext="M C l R D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele will decline due to natural selection.

skill.text: 3.B: State the null hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
